laboratory_examinations.findings: Slightly elevated TSH levels at age 11 months and throughout childhood.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: TSH levels continued to show abnormalities during childhood.

laboratory_examinations.findings: High T4 levels at age 11 months and throughout childhood.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: T4 levels remained high during childhood.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Low T3 levels at age 11 months and throughout childhood.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: T3 levels continued to remain low during childhood.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Elevated rT3 levels (measured during L-T3 treatment).
Considerably reduced, measured at 11 U/g hemoglobin (normal range 27.5–73.5).
Undetectable (below the detection limit of 10 µg/liter).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased to 58 µg/liter after 30 days of selenium supplementation.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Undetectable (below the detection limits of 0.016 mg/liter).
